cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then north-northeast toward Florida’s Big Bend, afterwards curving northeast along the GA/SC/NC coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key/Aucilla River

weather_observation.under_watch: None at port (Hurricane Watches now farther north)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the St. Mary’s River, GA northward to Edisto Beach, SC (outside Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Middle of Longboat Key northward to Indian Pass, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast from Chokoloskee through Tampa Bay to Big Bend, then Georgia and the Carolinas coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-57 mph) with gusts near hurricane force expected Tuesday night into Wednesday morning at Port Manatee.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 4–6 ft above ground possible in Tampa Bay, including the port, especially around high tide early Wednesday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with local maxima to 10 inches could cause flash and urban flooding in the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents.
